Source: DEPLOY_WEBSITE.md

Your package website is ready to deploy! Follow these steps to make it live.

Step 1: Wait for GitHub Actions to Complete â±ï¸

After pushing your code, GitHub Actions automatically builds your website.

  1. Go to: https://github.com/ianmoran11/openstockflow/actions
  2. Look for: The â€œpkgdownâ€ workflow
  3. Wait for: A green checkmark âœ… (usually takes 2-5 minutes)

If you see a yellow circle ğŸŸ¡, the workflow is still running. Wait for it to complete.

Step 2: Verify the gh-pages Branch Exists ğŸ”

The pkgdown workflow creates a special gh-pages branch with your website files.

  1. Go to: https://github.com/ianmoran11/openstockflow/branches
  2. Look for: A branch called gh-pages
  3. If it exists, youâ€™re ready for the next step!

Step 3: Configure GitHub Pages âš™ï¸

Now tell GitHub to serve your website from the gh-pages branch:

  1. Go to: https://github.com/ianmoran11/openstockflow/settings/pages
  2. Under â€œBuild and deploymentâ€:
    • Source: Select â€œDeploy from a branchâ€
    • Branch: Select gh-pages
    • Folder: Select / (root)
  3. Click â€œSaveâ€

You should see a message saying â€œYour site is ready to be published atâ€¦â€

Step 4: Add Website URL to Repository About Section ğŸ”—

Make the website link visible on your repository homepage:

  1. Go to: https://github.com/ianmoran11/openstockflow
  2. Click the âš™ï¸ gear icon next to â€œAboutâ€ (top right of the page)
  3. In the â€œWebsiteâ€ field, enter: https://ianmoran11.github.io/openstockflow/
  4. Optionally add a description: Categorical Stock-Flow Modeling with Compositional Diagrams
  5. Check the box for â€œUse your GitHub Pages websiteâ€ (if available)
  6. Click â€œSave changesâ€

Now your website link will appear prominently in the repositoryâ€™s About section!

Step 5: Wait for Deployment ğŸŒ

GitHub Pages typically takes 2-10 minutes to deploy after configuration.

Your website will be live at: ### ğŸŒ https://ianmoran11.github.io/openstockflow/

Verify Deployment âœ…

Once deployed, your website should show: - ğŸ  Home page with package overview and quick start - ğŸ“š Reference with all functions organized by topic - ğŸ“– Articles with all 8 vignettes - ğŸ” Search functionality - ğŸ“± Mobile-responsive design

Troubleshooting ğŸ”§

Website shows 404 error?

  • Wait a few more minutes - initial deployment can take up to 10 minutes
  • Check that the pkgdown workflow completed successfully (green checkmark)
  • Verify GitHub Pages is configured to use gh-pages branch

Workflow failed?

  • Go to: https://github.com/ianmoran11/openstockflow/actions
  • Click on the failed workflow to see error logs
  • Most common issues are dependencies or R version problems

Website is blank or shows old content?

  • GitHub Pages can cache content. Wait 5-10 minutes or try:
    • Hard refresh your browser (Cmd+Shift+R on Mac, Ctrl+Shift+R on Windows)
    • Clear your browser cache
    • Try in a private/incognito window

Future Updates ğŸ”„

Good news! Your website will automatically rebuild whenever you: - Push changes to the main branch - Update any documentation - Add new vignettes - Modify the README

No manual steps needed after initial setup! ğŸ‰

What Your Website Includes ğŸ“¦

âœ… Beautiful tidyverse-style design âœ… All function documentation organized by topic âœ… 8 comprehensive vignettes: - Quick Start guides (Algebraic + Pipe-based) - Introduction tutorials (Algebraic + Pipe-based) - Composition guides (Algebraic + Pipe-based) - Mathematical Foundations (Algebraic + Pipe-based) âœ… Search functionality across all documentation âœ… Responsive mobile layout âœ… Automatic updates on every push

Questions?

If you run into issues: 1. Check the Actions tab for workflow logs 2. Review GitHub Pages documentation: https://docs.github.com/en/pages 3. Verify the pkgdown badge on your README shows a green checkmark
